title: Taco Bell pulls beef from some stores on quality concerns
text:
Taco Bell has recalled 2.3 million pounds of beef from stores in 21 states after a customer reported finding a metal shaving in their food.

The fast-food outlet said it removed the seasoned beef from its restaurants and distribution centers by Monday and there had been no reports of illness over the affected product.

Julie Masino, President of North America, Taco Bell Corp, said: 'Nothing is more important than our customers’ safety, and nothing means more to us than their trust.

'As soon as we received the first consumer complaint, we immediately acted to remove the product from the affected restaurants and proactively worked with the supplier to inform the USDA of our steps to protect our guests.'

The problem was discovered when a customer reported they found a metal shaving in their menu item.

The company said it immediately partnered with its supplier to shut down the supply chain, and remove the product from restaurants and distribution centers. It also said it notified the United States Department of Agriculture.

It added: 'There have been no confirmed reports of adverse reactions due to consumption of these products.

'Anyone concerned about an injury or illness should contact a healthcare provider.'

The company says the beef didn't meet its quality standards. Affected locations are in Michigan, Kentucky, Ohio and elsewhere, though the company could not immediately say how many stores were no longer serving seasoned beef.

The seasoned beef was produced at one plant location on only one of the two lines used to produce it.

Customers were complaining on Twitter about not being able to satiate late-night cravings over the weekend. In a statement, the company apologized for any inconvenience

Customers were complaining on Twitter about not being able to satiate late-night cravings. In a statement, the company apologized for any inconvenience.

On Twitter, some customers reacted with anger that the chain ran out of one of its most popular ingredients.

One wrote: 'update: apparently there’s a shortage of beef at Taco Bell... yo like you should just close???.'

Another claimed: ' Hey @tacobell can you guys be real about what’s going on with your beef. I love eating there and the secrecy of what’s going on makes me afraid to ever eat at your restaurant again.'

On Saturday, Taco Bell restaurants in some states asked customers to try chicken or steak in their burritos after it stopped serving seasoned beef amid quality concerns.

The company said it told affected restaurants to stop serving the beef as it replenishes supplies because the beef didn't meet its quality standards.
description: Taco Bell had to recall seasoned beef from outlets across the U.S. after a customer reported finding a metal shaving in food they had ordered. The outlet said the product had been discarded.
